hypothesis_content.title: Post-News Sentiment Reversal on Low Volume Confirmation
hypothesis_content.statement: When significant crypto news triggers a >3% BTC move within 2 hours, but the move occurs on declining volume (current hour volume < 70% of 5-hour average) and the 15-minute TICK score (bullish-bearish tweet ratio) shows fading momentum (change < 0.1), fading the initial move provides a profitable timing edge over the next 4-8 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: News-driven spikes on low volume often represent liquidity gaps rather than sustainable momentum. The combination of fading social sentiment and weak volume participation creates a high-probability timing edge for reversal trades.
entry_conditions: BTC absolute price change > 3% in 2 hours following identifiable news event
Current hour volume < 70% of 5-hour rolling average volume
15-min crypto TICK score momentum (Δ over last 2 readings) < 0.1
No concurrent major equity market move (>1.5% SPX)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Retrace 50% of the initial 2-hour move OR 4 hours elapsed
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price extends beyond 110% of the initial 2-hour move

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 60% of low-volume news spikes continue in the same direction beyond the 110% extension level, indicating these are actually initiation moves rather than exhaustion.
